Reviews.Title: Great tv for the Price!
Reviews.Author: JR
Reviews.Content: The previous reviewer got this tv from the same place I did. Sears had the best price for this size tv after I checked around. I was impressed with the service I got there as well. Panasonic is a quality name and is tops for trouble free manufacturers for tv's, and this one has a great picture for my needs. Since I got an HDTV cable box the image is crystal clear. I also think the sound quality is great. It's not a fancy tv with LED or 120MHz, or wifi capabilty, but those tv's cost a lot more. But for a non-LED this screen is thin. As for 60MHZ vs. 120, you may notice a difference, but I don't think it's worth paying extra to avoid the occasional jitter. If you want streaming you are better of with getting another device for this such as a PS3. Many reviewers with wifi capable tv's built in complain they don't work well or need adapters anyway. For my needs this tv is first class. I love Amazon, but they don't always have the best price.

Reviews.Title: great TV!!!
Reviews.Author: K. Chan
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV 2 days ago for Euro 2012. Before I bought this TV, I can't find enough comments and reviews. But I was confident it's a good TV when I was comparing with another TVs (Samsung, Sony, LG) in the store. The color is so natural, screen isn't too bright which you could watch for a long time and won't feel tired. I also worried about the 60Hz, but I am so happy now after watching all kinds of sports including hockey, football, soccer without notice any motion blur. Sales person always tell you to go for 120Hz but not this one. Setting is easy, color is right on using the default setting. Volume is loud even in a living room - I use only one third of the max. As a picky web designer, I am suprise I can find a great LCD TV for this price!  Trust me!

Reviews.Title: My Fourth Panasonic HD!
Reviews.Author: Smart Shopper
Reviews.Content: This is my forth Panasonic HD (all are still in use) so I was not looking to spend alot of money.  Got this from Sears today for $500. The picture is great for cable TV. You would not notice the 60MHz blurs unless someone told you to look for them.  No problems at all with the viewing angle.  It does not have internet access but if you have PS3 or a Roku, you're all set.  I looked at several brands in the store and the pictures all look the same - the only difference between them is price and quality.  If your budget is $500, this is the one to get!

Reviews.Title: Impressive and Affordable
Reviews.Author: Evan
Reviews.Content: We have been on the lookout for a new HDTV to replace our 7 year old EDTV for a while now.  After several months of research, we purchased a Samsung LED but after a few days, we hated it and returned it.  Back to the drawing board.  We wanted to stick with Panasonic and preferably plasma but unfortunately, a good 90% of 2012 models of all televisions only come with 2 HDMI now (why, we don't understand).  We need 4 HMDI ports! We've tried 3 different HDMI switch boxes and just don't like that route.Recently, we came across this television (which has 3 HDMI) and thought, what the heck, let's give it a try.  Wow!! Are we ever impressed! The visual quality is perfect for us, the menu is simple, no Smart TV features (which we don't need or want).  This is a very simple but fantastic model.My first beef was how thick it is but at the same time, it's so light in weight.  The only con I have to complain about is the sound quality...not the best but in combination with our surround system, it works.If you want a Smart TV or super thin model, keep looking but if you're on a budget and want something fantastic for it's price range, pick this TV up!!

Reviews.Title: Gaming and Sports
Reviews.Author: Slander
Reviews.Content: I won't pay a monthly cable/satellite bill, and stream all my media content to the tv through an xbox and tablet. Shopping for tv's I was very impressed with Panasonic's LCD HD picture but most of their television had high end features that were superfluous, like integrated wifi and apps, and were too expensive. Finding this quality of a picture, from a quality manufacture, at 42" of LCD tv, for $500.00 is good deal. After a couple weeks of gaming, watching the Kings, and now the NBA finals, I love the picture! Sports and gaming really look nice on this tv.My only complaint, probably should be taken with a grain of salt as I am a musician and serious music aficionado, is the sound quality is unimpressive and lacks bass. I've been turning the volume up quite a bit up to hear the commentary over the crowd noise. The bass seems thin when streaming music or movies, but then again this was only $500.00 tv and its not intended to have stand-alone quality sound.After upgrading with a refurb Sharp SB600 sound bar and woofer the sound issue is gone.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre TV, step down from 2011 models
Reviews.Author: Smart Shopper CA
Reviews.Content: Given positive experiences with the 2011 Panasonic models, I chose this budget 42" model. I'm not that impressed with it to be honest.2011 models had IPS panel screens which offer deep blacks, uniform image quality, and excellent viewing angles. This TV however doesn't have these advantages. Black looks gray or even green tinged at times, and the problem is worse as you move to the sides. If you look at a solid background you can see the edges of the screen having brighter areas than the center.In HD mode the picture is very good but for simple digital and analog channels the picture is very grainy. I spent quite a bit of time adjusting settings to get a satisfactory picture. The remote it comes with is very poor and some buttons were unresponsive right out of the box.Given the price, it was an ok buy, but with Sony and Samsung models dropping in price, spend an extra $50-100 and get a much nicer TV. From the reviews I've seen, Panasonic missed the mark this year with this model as well as the LED screens, probably to save cost. I hope they shape up again.

Reviews.Title: Good TV - severely limited output connectors
Reviews.Author: Que
Reviews.Content: So far the TV has been fine. Good picture, simple to configure. My biggest gripe is there is only ONE output from the TV - digital audio output.  No HDMI ARC. No optical. Not even RCA! So, if you are going to hook this up to an external sound system you better make sure it takes digital audio or buy some sort of converter. I find it ridiculous that a TV currently still in production does not have HDMI ARC or optical!What makes this even more frustrating is that I bought a Panasonic Viera sound system (Panasonic SC-BTT195) for the sole purpose of making sure they work together. Guess what? The Panasonic SC-BTT195 only takes RCA, optical and HDMI ARC - NOT digital audio. I think it is almost criminal that two products made by the same company in the same product line by design cannot work together. I have a kludge in place but will need to order a digital audio -> optical converter. Hope I don't lose anything in the process.So, would I buy this TV again? No - for the simple reason is it that is woefully archaic in its output formats.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: TimH
Reviews.Content: This was an upgrade from a 32 Vizio.  The picture is great.  Im not a tech guy so this isn't gonna be one of those post.  If you want a good tv at a great price I dont think you will find anything better...but look to the other reviews about the hertz and all that junk.  But as far as I can tell...I can tell none of the slow frame movement.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: I was reading on frame rate an plasma vs lcd and since i am a prime member and the shipping to and fro is so easy, I thought i give this Viera a try. Usually I stay away from to good to be true deals like this but with the said above, i was sure that i did't risk anything.The picture is crystal clear the sound is surprisingly good as well. The firs thing i watched was Avatar to see the clearness of the picture. The second movie was Hitman to see how the frame rate holds up. Both flicks were blu-ray so the quality input was at max. Both times the TV performed flawlessly.Great deal. I would by it over and over again. I also bought the square trade warranty in case something happens down the road.

Reviews.Title: Great 42" TV
Reviews.Author: Leonard Hayashi
Reviews.Content: I had my new Panasonic Viera 42 inch tv up and running within minutes of opening the box and was very happy with the quality of the image. At this price ($500) I don't think you could really beat the value you get from this LCD tv.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: MtCrag "small ears"
Reviews.Content: Just received and the picture is 10 times better then the TCL I originally purchased. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Penelope Blechstein
Reviews.Content: great price!!! crisp and clear reception and pictures!! great TV for cost!!would recommend. Fits in close quarters - thin and not huge!!!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic value
Reviews.Author: D. Martinez "AlsoKnownAs"
Reviews.Content: For the price this TV has been great. The remote is no frills as is the set of features. I'm very much on board with that, I just wanted a TV, not a net box of any sort. Picture is excellent with rich color and no washout as far as I can tell. The sound is great as well. It could be improved upon with external speakers but not tinny and certainly passable in my living room which is on the small size.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this TV. This TV has no extra bells and whistles. But it does what it is supposed to do very well.I use it with a DirecTV HD receiver via HDMI. The picture is great (I primarily watch sports on this TV). I also am pleased with the built in speakers. I have the TV in a large room and the speakers are able to produce clear sound with no problems understanding the voices of announcers and actors.I am glad I bought this TV. It is my 2nd Panasonic flat screen and both are great. .

Reviews.Title: tv
Reviews.Author: Allison Culver
Reviews.Content: good picture, nice size, wish it were thinner and the sound were richer. Don't like the sound coming fro mthe bottom of the tv. Shoots to the floor

Reviews.Title: This is the second one in the house, and I love it
Reviews.Author: LeAnn McElrath
Reviews.Content: I already had one of these for the den, and decided to get one for my bedroom. I am not disappointed with the quality of the TV. Works great, and easy to mount on the wall.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Kris with a K Wind
Reviews.Content: I love being home and relaxing and watching TV again.  Because of two simple words...Viera and Clarity, I can fully enjoy TV again

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the price.
Reviews.Author: Sam Smith
Reviews.Content: People constantly tell me that it is a great TV- little do they know how little I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV

Reviews.Content: Love the clarity and the price was right too. Easy to install and sure was a great replacement for my old Quasar.

Reviews.Author: Eric J. Edfors
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV from Sears and after a little over a month turned it on with our remote, the screen made a popping sound and went dark.  Little cracks appeared in three separate areas under the screen.  Panasonic has refused to help us.  If you want to buy a junky product and deal with horrible customer service this is the TV for you.

Reviews.Title: waste of money
Reviews.Author: Rudy Morgenthaler
Reviews.Content: The television came cracked in the mail from the back and then it stopped working after only 3 months. Very bad investment despite the low price

Reviews.Title: A Great TV and Still Going Strong a Year Later
Reviews.Author: S. Fitzgerald "SandyInOhio"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for myself as a Christmas present at this time last year, and it's provided us with hours of entertainment. I've had absolutely no problems with this television, which really didn't cost very much money, and it's worked perfectly. Plus, if you're planning to buy a TV, you can't go wrong with Amazon and getting it delivered right to your door. I'm a single woman with a small car and there's no way I could have gotten this big TV home and in the house by myself! But as for this TV, it's been just perfect for a year now, and I just love it.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: Avid Fan
Reviews.Content: Got it as a gift for a loved one for X Mas.  No complaints from the loved one.  Was actually a pretty light TV and not hard to move the box, more awkward than heavy.  If it was still available I would recommend it to others for what Amazon charged at the time, good value.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: Kyle Dirks
Reviews.Content: My family has used this t.v. for about 9 months now and we are more than happy with it. Clear image, good sound, and cheap! We purchased using amazon prime, and I'm still astonished that this 42" t.v. was shipped for free. For a family of casual t.v. watchers, and gamers this has been a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Amazing deal on such a great tv
Reviews.Author: steph
Reviews.Content: I could not believe the price when i saw it. I recently moved into a new place and I traveled really light (just the bare necessities) the most I had was my phone. I expected to spend quite some money to get myself to a place where i was move comfortable and had more so when I came across this deal I couldn't pass out on it nor did I expect something great. Man was I wrong. This tv has been working wonderfully, nice big pictures ways to set it up and adjust everything the way I like and can connect my other devices to it. I am just happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Great value and price
Reviews.Author: Alexander Sutherland
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present so we shopped around. Considering they always run specials on televisions during the holiday season we had many choices including Costco. Not only was this the best blue for a name brand, but we didn't have to get it in Nsd out of the car- it came right to our doorstep on the day promised. That was the best part!

Reviews.Title: very pleased
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this TV... great picture quality, very decent sound, easy setup... IMHO I think the Hz level is more than adequate... though I do not game on this.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product, Better Price
Reviews.Author: Golfnut "Capecodder"
Reviews.Content: Cannot believe I purchased this quality HD TV for the price I paid. Excellent crisp picture, good sound, and easy setup.Bought two of this same Panasonic 42 " TVs for less than $390 apiece. Big box stores were $100-$125 more.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: Have had the TV for about 6 months now. It has a great crisp picture picture, good sound, has good picture even in a well lit room and even with the sun shining on it when i have my windows open. Only thing I dont like about it is the slight high pitch noise when you first turn it on but goes away after a minute. Delivered on time and undamaged.

Reviews.Title: Nice television for the money. It was a gift for a close relative and it was well received. Would order again.
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: This was a nice gift to my mom in law and it worked out great. I would suggest it for a close family member.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: Tanika M. Williams "Chaining Tanny"
Reviews.Content: great tv for the pricegave this as a gift & the person loved itwould recommend when it is sold on sale again

Reviews.Title: Panasonic 42"
Reviews.Author: M. Belken
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for someone that is more interested in a very good picture VS more bells and features. Great quality and value for price, seems more life like color than others at same price. My Panasonics have out lasted every other TVs I have owned.

Reviews.Title: First flat screen ...
Reviews.Author: M. Noffsinger
Reviews.Content: so for us it's a huge upgrade.  It was easy to set up and the size is just what we wanted.  The picture is clear.  I'd definitely recommend it as a good buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Input doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Trillium
Reviews.Content: Tried to watch a video on this tv and it would not work.  Tried everything possible and it never left hdmi 1.  If you want thingssimplified make sure you get a smart tv.

Reviews.Title: Christmas present to me :-)
Reviews.Author: Goge
Reviews.Content: We got tired of the big box TV from the '90's that wouldn't get all the digital channels. This has a great picture, gets all the channels we're used to watching and takes up a fraction of the space of the old one.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: William J Rathyen
Reviews.Content: A Great price. Really nice, easy to install. Realistic colors and HD picture. Would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: R. Ware
Reviews.Content: This is a good basic TV set. The picture is really good - we use it on the porch for watching football and sports and the picture is terrific !

Reviews.Title: What a deal!
Reviews.Author: Morgan and Mellon
Reviews.Content: This is my second Panasonic. Had a 32" which I loved, and wanted a bigger screen. Easy to set up, and the price was the best of all--one day deal of $409.  Since then, it seems to be consistently $599.  Delivered on time in excellent condition.

Reviews.Title: For our bedroom
Reviews.Author: L. Peene "LP"
Reviews.Content: We don't watch a lot of tv in the bedroom, so this is ok, setting up the settings was funky, but we figured it out. Very little for a descriptive manual.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Grace
Reviews.Content: It's a great TV! And the price is reasonable! I just love it! But we should buy cable by ourselves, don't forget it...

Reviews.Title: Great product for great price
Reviews.Author: R. Campos
Reviews.Content: Awesome tv for a great price. Very good quality and nothing but pleased.  Would definitely recommend buying this television, for anyone in the market...

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Christopher Montalvo
Reviews.Content: Really good tv with awesome graphics love playing ps3 here, it is a really good tv with good sound really satisfied love the tv

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Ellen Carlberg
Reviews.Content: We love the color on this tv.  I would have given it 5 stars but the tv shut off twice so I'm a little worried about that.  We went into the sleep mode and it isn't that.  We think because of the weather it might have gone off but it went right on when we pushed the on button.  Anyway, we would recommend this tv.  It's worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Stacy Webb
Reviews.Content: TV was very easy to connect to satellite receiver with an excellent picture and sound quality.  I would recommend this television to anyone.  After searching several months for a television to replace the 25" that became hard to read when receiver was upgraded, this TV fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: Good deal and product
Reviews.Author: David Flaherty
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with the deal and television. Good performance and quality, picture, sound, menus and construction resulted in a worthwhile purchase.

Reviews.Title: Still hard to believe
Reviews.Author: Snakey
Reviews.Content: I am still in a little disbelief on the deal I got on this TV.  The TV looks absolutely great and was a steal for $409.  It connected to all our devices without a problem and the picture looks really good.  The delivery took less than 24 hours with the two day prime shipping option.The speakers sound loud and clear in our small living room, with not distortion problems what so ever.  I heard some of the cheaper TVs have a problem with really bad speakers, but  this was not the case.  It also weighs about 30 pounds and was easy enough to hang on our wall.I have only had the TV for a few days and will update if anything goes wrong.  For now, I am really happy with my TV upgrade.  Im almost tempted to buy a second for my basement.

Reviews.Title: just okay
Reviews.Author: robin gash
Reviews.Content: first step into HD tv. no problems with packaging or delivery --needs better set-up instructions --- hard to adjust picture quality --should have bought a step up from this model or a different brand --

Reviews.Title: Bang For Buck
Reviews.Author: fumanchu
Reviews.Content: This TV is excellent for the price. A bit grainy for dark shots, but I have basic cable, so what can you expect? Multiple HDMI ports, and 1080p. Quite the steal.

Reviews.Title: Beyong EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: R M Walters
Reviews.Content: I have been a CE integrator for a lot of years.  I have speced Panasonic plasmas 1st, other plasma displays 2nd for ALL my clients.  This time my grandson needed a display for video games.  It is a well known that plasma tecnology is not correct for gaming[image retention] so this is  MY 1st shot with LCD technology......not bad, actually VERY surprised........LCD: "you've come a long way,baby"; Panasonic. IMHO, you've got BOTH markets "locked"

Reviews.Title: THE PERFECT GIFT
Reviews.Author: D. J. Girard
Reviews.Content: After purchasing one TV that was delivered literally crushed, I was very pleased when this television, that was purchased as a gift, arrived perfect. My son reports that this TV is awesome. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great value
Reviews.Author: houston2sandiego
Reviews.Content: Replaced a Maganavox and very pleased with the picture, the sound is another story.  Buy yourself a sound bar; you'll need it.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV.
Reviews.Author: Dr Doctor
Reviews.Content: Unless someone can prove to me otherwise which I would like it if you could.Take note that this model VIERA TC-L42U5 does have a USB player which it says on their chart and it does not have a media player according to the chart. Now the image graphics makes you think you can play movies off your usb stick but not this model. Now in the tv menus they call it a media player but actually it is only the USB player which lets you show photos and music only.  so bottom line..this tv model TC-L42U5 wont let you play movies off your USB stick. If someone knows how to do this please respond. I just got the tv first time for big screen. The TV seems great. Actually I am more dissapointed that HD TV transimission of movies is compressed more than I though it would be. News looks great. Movies look crappy but that is not the tvs fault but HD cable service providers and all their compression.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Viera
Reviews.Author: Brooklyn booster
Reviews.Content: We purchased a Panasonic Viera HD LCD TV on Amazon last month, and we are very pleased with the clarity and quality of the visuals and the sound.  My son has a PS3 gaming system connected to the TV, and all has been working well.  We really appreciate the HD quality.  A good product

Reviews.Title: Unsupported Option.
Reviews.Author: JSM
Reviews.Content: Purchased this display - attempted to hook a PC up via the VGA port. Worked fine until we powered the TV off via the remote. When we tried to turn it back on, no image came back.  In order to get the image to return we had to disconnect the VGA cable from the back, fully power the TV off, wait 20 seconds, power the TV back on, and then reconnect the source.When we attempted to contact support, their answer was "Use an HDMI cable.", followed by "Purchase a VGA to HDMI adapter."If you're not going to support an industry standard connection (VGA - 15 pin) on a standard resolution (XGA - 1024x768), don't bother including the connector or indicating that it has a "PC Input".It's going back.*Edit 06-SEP-12*We opted to exchange the unit for a new one in the hopes that it was a single product defect.  We recieved the new unit and experienced the same issue - unit would not power on with a DB-15 VGA connector attached.  Same cycle worked (unplug, fully power off, power on, wait for no signal message, attach connector).  Powered off unit, then would not power on again.

Reviews.Title: Turns off by itself, poor color accuracy
Reviews.Author: LinuxFancy
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 2:  We returned the replacement unit as well.  The color balance was poor and hours of adjustment and comparing to our old TV could never get it to a point where we were happy with it.  The blacks were greenish or brownish, and whenever we got one color looking OK, the others would be skewed.  Skin tones never looked good either.It's too bad - all we want is a nice-looking television without 3D or wifi or apps.UPDATE 1, 9/24/2012:We called Panasonic, but that was pretty useless.  The customer support was really bad - they barely seemed to be paying attention, asked the same questions repeatedly, and kept getting confused about what model we had.  Their only suggestion to improve the picture was very limited (turn down the contrast and turn up the brightness - which we had already done).  As for the "turning off" issue, they said they had never heard of that problem, and suggested I take it to an authorized repair shop.  Well, it won't fit in my car, and they don't offer on site repair for TVs less than 47" - so we returned to Amazon for a replacement.  The color seems slightly better on this one, but still not quite right.  We are still playing with it.  The new unit has turned off by itself once so far (in about 4 days - today was the first time).  If the issue recurs, or we can't get the colors set to our satisfaction, we will return it and try another model.  Still love Amazon's support!ORIGINAL REVIEW:Got the TV yesterday.  No issues with the initial setup, spent some time getting it hooked up with our XBOX and Mac Mini.  We get a lousy signal in my house so we didn't bother testing the "TV" part of it.  It looks fine, but the colors are different from our last TV.  We ended up turning the contrast down and that seemed a bit better.But after a few hours, the TV just turned itself off.  No flashing lights, no nothing - right in the middle of doing something on the computer.  It turned right back on again when we hit the power button on the remote.Today, same thing - this time we were using the XBOX, and it just turned off.  This was again after a few hours of use (browsing online, watching a movie on Netflix).  Again, no lights, and it turned right back on once we hit the power.This TV does have some "Eco" settings - by default, it will turn itself off after 10 minutes of "no signal".  This works fine, and it pops up a warning in the corner about 3 minutes before it shuts off.  There is also an option to turn off after 3 hours without a key press, but the default behavior is "Stay on".  I turned off the 10 minute option also - just in case there is a bug with this feature - and will test again tomorrow.Haven't decided yet if we will try to engage Panasonic for support, or just send it back to Amazon.  It would be a good deal if the TV just worked.  Alas, it seems that it doesn't.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Christopher Anderson "Chicago Sailor"
Reviews.Content: Replaced a 5 year old Samsung with this one.  This is a great HD tv.  Much lighter than the Samsung, better picture, and it gives off less heat (if that matters to you).

Reviews.Title: It's great so far
Reviews.Author: Publiclibrarian "arh30081"
Reviews.Content: Delivery was quick--no damage at all. Picture is clear and brilliant. So far I haven't figured out how to use the "smart" functions--setting up the wi-fi etc. but I am thrilled with the television and would buy the same one again.

Reviews.Title: Dont bother if you watch Netflix
Reviews.Author: joe bitterman
Reviews.Content: The colors on the TV are great, but if there's a scene in the dark, forget it.  Especially with Netflix, you'll see this odd pixelated/glossy mess on the blacks.  The only way to rid yourself of it is to tone down the brightness to the point were all the colors are muted.  A standard definition TV is less of a distraction. Return.

Reviews.Title: default screen is not starting a manufacturing defect

Reviews.Content: I chose this rating because the product came with a manufacturing defect on the screen, this game is not a defect and now who I COVERED.I did not like: that being purchased by amazon are so little serious and responsible.and of course do not recommend buying or my friends or family at this store.was not an issue of relocation is quality problem by manufacturing defect.I turn on the tv and disgust that the picture on the screen is very bad half the imagnes are dark and slow movements are not recommended as

Reviews.Title: Item received was smashed.
Reviews.Author: Joseph E Medeiros
Reviews.Content: TV's entire back was smashed, even though the box was in great condition.Was not able to get a replacement tv, because tv was no longer in stock. Big headache.

Reviews.Title: Read before you buy for a dorm.
Reviews.Author: R. Klein
Reviews.Content: My son purchased this for a college dorm, but now he needs the Channel Master CM-7001 HDTV Antenna and Clear QAM Cable Tuner for another $125 on top of the tv price just to work in his dorm.  You'd think this tv already had what it needed to use in a dorm, but it doesn't.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: RAUL GONZALEZ
Reviews.Content: This TV is crap and sellers alike. The product arrived and no good. I ordered two televisions equal and both came with problems.It's a waste of money. The seller is irresponsible to sell these products do not work.I feel cheated. They are thieves who sell junk.

Reviews.Title: Lasted 14 months
Reviews.Author: Marc A. Alexander
Reviews.Content: TV lasted 14 months. I knew more than service man that was sent out. Didn't repair it. Always thought Panasonic made a quality product.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Quality, only lasted 15 months possibly unsafe!
Reviews.Author: Allen Cassell
Reviews.Content: I bought this Television last year for $549 here on Amazon and everything had been great until last night when it went out. I turned it on and it let out a loud crackle. Now will not respond. Something must have burnt up on the inside because I faintly smelled smoke. I would stay away from this product, I'm just glad I was home when it went out. Also, Panasonic will not do anything to make it right, because it is 3 months out of warranty. Stay away!
